message.content:
cs.PL, cs.AR, cs.LO, cs.SE, cs.CR 

Reasoning: 
- cs.PL (Programming Languages): The paper proposes a program transformation technique to enable verification of weak memory models using Sequential Consistency tools. This falls under the domain of programming languages research. 
- cs.AR (Architecture): The paper deals with weak memory models of multiprocessors, which is a topic related to computer architecture. 
- cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science): The paper discusses the soundness of the proposed transformation technique, which involves logical reasoning. 
- cs.SE (Software Engineering): The paper aims to improve software verification techniques, which is a topic related to software engineering. 
- cs.CR (Cryptography and Security): Although not the main focus, the paper briefly mentions the security implications of weak memory models and how the proposed technique can help in detecting bugs. This makes cs.CR a possible sub-category as well.
